meanings.definition: A person who commemorates or honors someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The school children were proud commemorators of their teacher's achievements.
meanings.sent2: The commemorators gathered at the memorial to pay their respects.
meanings.sent3: The commemorators brought flowers and candles to honor their ancestors.
meanings.sent4: She was a dedicated commemorator, always ensuring the legacy of her community was remembered.
meanings.sent5: The commemorators' heartfelt speeches moved everyone in attendance.

meanings.definition: Those who participate in ceremonies or events to remember or celebrate a person or event.
meanings.sent1: The commemorators sang songs of remembrance at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: Family members and friends joined as commemorators to honor the fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The commemorators wore colorful costumes to liven up the event.
meanings.sent4: The group of commemorators lit candles to symbolize unity and hope.
meanings.sent5: The commemorators' presence added a sense of solemnity to the occasion.
